explicit.speaker: Sudheer
explicit.text: But it's still not fully, fully clear, right?

explicit.speaker: manuele
explicit.text: I still have to understand. Then what does it conflict in terms of operational efficiency from the next weeks?

explicit.speaker: manuele
explicit.text: I don't know how the holacracy works with respect of alternative proposals that are being collected out of the inner circle.

explicit.speaker: John Stokes (Real Ventures)
explicit.text: I'm still not always sure what it is and what it isn't. And it seems, for example, the decision that Manuela was pointing out, part of the rationale was, let's not use an extractive product. Let's use something that's more regenerative. I really think understanding what... Regenerative is having a common understanding of what it is and what it isn't

breakthroughs.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
breakthroughs.text: We know that collaboration is the true architecture of evolution, where unity becomes strength, and diversity becomes harmony. We choose love as our compass, and integrity as our plan. We honor coherence, weaving finance, technology, and governance into service of life itself.

breakthroughs.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
breakthroughs.text: So integrating financial, digital, physical, and cultural infrastructure. And that's our way of getting to that vision. And I hope this vision, this purpose. know. it this purpose. is inspiring enough for us collectively to take this action forward.

breakthroughs.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
breakthroughs.text: So, just putting a seed there, that whatever has been shared... is a work in progress. there's a huge uncertainty. and especially at the beginning. and we have two choices to play with uncertainty. either we celebrate it with knowing that there is magic will unfold at some point of time and have the courage to walk through that uncertainty or we can embrace it with with concern and this is a choice that we make personally and we can make this choice but also we can make the other choice and this is for me here an invitation to embrace uncertainty and and for us collectively and I the responsibility for a better communication, starting with myself, and a clear communication.

breakthroughs.speaker: Iris Lubitch
breakthroughs.text: uncertainty is not only in better word, it's a completely global atmosphere, people works now for Microsoft, they're completely uncertain if they are going, so it's not, you know, and yeah, this is, we are in a transition, all humanity, and this is what we all experience, and the second thing is that the beauty is that compared to others, others, because we have values, and because we are committed for transparency, and trust, and courage, and love, this is our certainty, this, that's what give us certainty, at least for my side, I feel much safer here in this environment, compared to the jungle outside, so, that's what I wish to state, 60 seconds about certainty.

breakthroughs.speaker: Christopher Herghelegiu
breakthroughs.text: And I think, you know, obviously, I think Natalie's done a great job of, you know, beginning the well-being. And I think that's probably a good place to maybe start if you have some of those concerns or thoughts or ideas just to communicate it so we have a baseline. The second part, now that we have the platform up. part, up, up, we up, platform platform up, we have It would be my recommendation that our anchor group, that we post that information to the collective group after every meeting, and maybe even have some short-term initiatives that are done for every group, that the collective group can look in and say, wait, you know, I know this person, or I may be able to add value there. Just open up that ability to the collective group to help, and to Charles' point, is to share some of that workload.

breakthroughs.speaker: Sudheer
breakthroughs.text: But at the same time, on the flip side, what I've also seen probably because of this, is that, I mean, don't need a response, but an invitation for all of y'all is basically it, then see what I can get from this. I'm still seeing a bit of that. I would, I mean, request that the approach should be, what can I give to this first, right? And approach it from the standpoint of what can I give for Better World? Because it's all still new.

breakthroughs.speaker: Olga Duka
breakthroughs.text: I think as long as we have transparent, safe space and ability to understand why we're here all together, conflicts of interest shouldn't scare us at all. They are all solvable, as long as we can just communicate. But I wanted to maybe highlight something else more. It's not just expectations on the possible outcomes and pathways, how it can be done, should be done, how to rely on all of those things and so on. It's more of the complexity itself, so many multi-faceted pieces.

actions.speaker: Team Metaluck
actions.text: Post creed/values deck to Symbiosis General Hub

actions.speaker: Sudheer
actions.text: Schedule 3â€“4h MVS integration & tech infrastructure alignment call w/ relevant leads

actions.speaker: Christopher Herghelegiu
actions.text: Post Anchor Circle updates to Symbiosis after each meeting

actions.speaker: Nathalie Nebelius (Cordinata AB)
actions.text: Send bi-weekly Anchor Circle updates to ecosystem

actions.speaker: Team Metaluck
actions.text: Post questions/discussion points in Symbiosis General Hub

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: The vision, mission, and the creed that Shyamana just beautifully read out were kind of formally adopted as the underlying basis for Better World.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: The core values also were finalized.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: For now we agreed to essentially follow holacracy principles to be adopted as an interim governance framework.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: A provisional anchor circle was formed

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: Farhad brought to the table that we should update the corporate structure, what Alex had presented at the gathering, to also create another separate legal entity that we are calling as Better World Private Equity Limited.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: We agreed that while the product is in an alpha stage, we can at least still start using some parts of it.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: The legal sub-circle charter was adopted and approved by the anchor circle, with IRS agreeing to take the lead on this.

decisions.speaker: Sudheer
decisions.text: We also voted on the purpose through Symbiosis

decisions.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
decisions.text: So, it's not easy. So, we decided, okay, well, we will postpone or delay that integration.

recommendations.text: Define clear roles and responsibilities within each circle to enable broader participation and workload distribution, as suggested by Charles and Christopher.
Utilize the Symbiosis platform more actively for posting updates, questions, and discussions to enhance transparency and engagement across the ecosystem.
Conduct a dedicated session to clarify the definition and practical application of 'regeneration' within the Better World context, addressing John Stokes' point.
Expedite the finalization of circle charters and the governance framework to provide clarity on decision-making processes and power distribution, as highlighted by Alex and Manuele.
Maintain open and transparent communication channels, especially during periods of uncertainty, to foster trust and address potential conflicts of interest proactively, as emphasized by Olga.
Prioritize the MVS integration and tech infrastructure alignment call to streamline efforts and leverage existing tools effectively, as proposed by Sudheer and Manuele.
Develop a transparent compensation framework that recognizes contributions (time, effort, financial) to address concerns and align with the ecosystem's values, as discussed by Sudheer.
